docs.title: Welcome to My First MkDocs Site
docs.text: This is a sample documentation site built with MkDocs and the Material for MkDocs theme.

docs.title: What is MkDocs?
docs.text: MkDocs is a fast, simple and downright gorgeous static site generator that's geared towards building project documentation. Documentation source files are written in Markdown, and configured with a single YAML configuration file.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
This sample site demonstrates:

  • Beautiful Theme: Using Material for MkDocs with light/dark mode toggle
  • Code Highlighting: Syntax highlighting for code blocks
  • Navigation: Multi-level navigation structure
  • Search: Built-in search functionality
  • GitHub Pages: Automated deployment via GitHub Actions

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Check out the Getting Started guide to learn how to use this template.

docs.title: Example Code Block
docs.text:
def hello_world():
    """A simple hello world function."""
    print("Hello, World!")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    hello_world()

Pro Tip

You can use admonitions to highlight important information!

docs.title: About This Project
docs.text: This is a sample MkDocs site demonstrating best practices for documentation.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text:
This project serves as a template or "Hello World" for creating documentation sites with:

  • MkDocs: A fast, simple static site generator
  • Material for MkDocs: A beautiful, responsive theme
  • GitHub Pages: Free hosting for your documentation
  • GitHub Actions: Automated deployment pipeline

docs.title: Why MkDocs?
docs.text:
MkDocs offers several advantages:

  1. Simplicity: Write in Markdown, configure with one YAML file
  2. Speed: Fast build times and instant preview
  3. Beautiful: Professional-looking themes out of the box
  4. Search: Built-in search functionality
  5. Extensible: Rich plugin ecosystem

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Welcome! This guide will help you get started with this MkDocs site.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before you begin, ensure you have the following installed:

  • Python 3.7 or higher
  • pip (Python package installer)

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Clone this repository:
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/first-project.git
cd first-project
  1. Install MkDocs and the Material theme:
pip install mkdocs mkdocs-material

docs.title: Building the Site
docs.text:
To build the documentation site locally:

mkdocs build

This creates a site directory with the static HTML files.

docs.title: Local Development
docs.text:
To preview your documentation as you write:

mkdocs serve

Then open your browser to http://127.0.0.1:8000

The site will automatically reload when you save changes to your Markdown files.

docs.title: Deploying to GitHub Pages
docs.text:
This project is configured with GitHub Actions to automatically deploy to GitHub Pages whenever you push to the main branch.

Manual Deployment

You can also deploy manually using: mkdocs gh-deploy

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: Learn how to customize your MkDocs site.

docs.title: The mkdocs.yml File
docs.text:
The mkdocs.yml file is the heart of your MkDocs site. It controls:

  • Site metadata
  • Theme settings
  • Navigation structure
  • Markdown extensions
  • And more!

docs.title: Site Information
docs.text:
site_name: My Documentation
site_description: A brief description
site_author: Your Name
site_url: https://example.com

docs.title: Repository Links
docs.text:
Link your documentation to its GitHub repository:

repo_name: username/repository
repo_url: https://github.com/username/repository

docs.title: Theme Customization
docs.text: This site uses the Material for MkDocs theme with several customizations.

docs.title: Color Palette
docs.text:
The theme supports both light and dark modes:

theme:
  palette:
    - scheme: default
      primary: indigo
      accent: indigo
    - scheme: slate
      primary: indigo
      accent: indigo

Available colors include: red, pink, purple, indigo, blue, cyan, teal, green, lime, yellow, amber, orange, and deep orange.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
Enable additional features:

theme:
  features:
    - navigation.tabs        # Top-level tabs
    - navigation.sections    # Expandable sections
    - navigation.top        # Back-to-top button
    - search.suggest        # Search suggestions
    - search.highlight      # Highlight search terms
    - content.code.copy     # Copy button for code blocks

docs.title: Markdown Extensions
docs.text:
This site uses several Markdown extensions for enhanced functionality:

  • Code Highlighting: pymdownx.highlight
  • Admonitions: Call-out boxes for notes, warnings, etc.
  • Tabbed Content: pymdownx.tabbed
  • Details/Summary: Collapsible sections

Example admonition:

Important

Always backup your configuration before making changes!

docs.title: Navigation Structure
docs.text:
Define your site's navigation in mkdocs.yml:

nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - Getting Started: getting-started.md
  - User Guide:
      - Installation: user-guide/installation.md
      - Configuration: user-guide/configuration.md
  - About: about.md

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: This page provides detailed installation instructions.

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• Operating System: Windows, macOS, or Linux
  • Python: Version 3.7 or higher
  • pip: Latest version recommended

docs.title: 1. Install Python
docs.text:
WindowsmacOSLinux

Download Python from python.org and run the installer.

Make sure to check "Add Python to PATH" during installation.

Using Homebrew: 

brew install python


sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install python3 python3-pip

docs.title: 2. Verify Installation
docs.text:
Check your Python installation:

python --version
pip --version

docs.title: 3. Install MkDocs
docs.text:
Install MkDocs and the Material theme:

pip install mkdocs mkdocs-material

docs.title: 4. Verify MkDocs Installation
docs.text:
mkdocs --version

You should see output indicating the version of MkDocs installed.

Installation Complete

You're all set! Head over to the Configuration guide to customize your site.

docs.title: Permission Errors
docs.text:
If you encounter permission errors on Linux/macOS, try:

pip install --user mkdocs mkdocs-material

docs.title: Command Not Found
docs.text:
If mkdocs command is not found, add Python's user bin directory to your PATH.

For more help, visit the MkDocs documentation.
